news.title: Castor and Google Summer of Code
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
We are proud to participate in the Summer of Code initiative sponsored by Google, and you are invited to join in the fun.
At Codehaus, you'll find some suggestions we find suitable for the program, and per definition we would be glad to support a few projects.
Please understand, though, that mentoring capacities will be limited, though we will try to dedicate as much time as possible to the suggested projects. That implies that we depend on your dedication during the preparation of the detailed specification and description of the outcome.
The timeframe for applications is May 1 - May 8. So have a look at the projects at offer, before you are sign up to the program and apply as a student to be mentored by us.

news.title: New source repository
news.author: Ralf Joachim
news.summary:
On April 14. 2006 we have migrated Castor source repository from CVS to SVN. At the moment we still have read only access to CVS but this does not reflect commits to SVN after the migration. The read only access to CVS is intended for you to create patches of your current work and move it over to SVN. Be aware that we will switch off CVS soon.
For details about SVN access please have a look at: SVN/JIRA.

news.title: Castor 1.0 (final) released
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
I've placed a copy of the final Castor 1.0 release at the Codehaus.
For details about features added and bugs fixed, please have a look at the release notes.

news.title: Castor 1.0M4 released
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
I've placed a copy of the Castor 1.0M4 release at the Codehaus.
This is the fourth (and last) milestone build for the upcoming 1.0 release. For details about the features added and the bugs fixed, please have a look at the release notes.
Please note that we are imposing a feature/code freeze in preparation for the final 1.0 release, which is currently scheduled for April 6, 2006.

news.title: Castor 1.0M3 released
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
I've placed a copy of the Castor 1.0M3 release at the Codehaus.
This is the third milestone build for the upcoming 1.0 release. For details about the features added and the bugs fixed, please have a look at the release notes.
At the moment, we are planning for a last milestone release at the end of March 2006, after which we will impose a code freeze in preparation for the final 1.0 release.

news.title: Castor 1.0M2 released
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
I've placed a copy of the Castor 1.0M2 release at the Codehaus.
This is the second milestone build for the upcoming 1.0 release. For details about the features added and the bugs fixed, please have a look at the release notes.
At the moment, we are planning for a third milestone release at the end of February 2006.

news.title: Castor 1.0M1 released
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
I've placed a copy of the Castor 1.0M1 release at the Codehaus.
This is milestone build for the upcoming 1.0 release, as has no correlation to Christmas at all .. ;-). For details about the features added and the bugs fixed, please have a look at the release notes.
We are still planning for a final Castor 1.0 release in January 2006.

news.title: Castor 0.9.9.1 released
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
I've placed a copy of the Castor 0.9.9.1 release at the Codehaus.
This is a maintenance release. For details about the features added and the bugs fixed, please have a look at the release notes.
We are still planning for a Castor 1.0 release in about 8+ weeks.

news.title: Castor 0.9.9 - Final release
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
I've placed a copy of the final Castor 0.9.9 release at the Codehaus.
This is a major feature release. For details about the features added and the bugs fixed, please have a look at the release notes.
We are currently planning for a Castor 1.0 release in about 8+ weeks, which we mainly see as a bug fix release and a one-time opportunity to get the HTML documentation into a better shape .. ;-). Please have a look at the project roadmap for details.
Please report any issues at the Castor Jira site.

news.title: Castor 0.9.9 - 2nd milestone build
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
I've placed a copy of the 2nd Castor 0.9.9 milestone build at the Codehaus.
This is a bug fix release only. For details about the bugs fixed since the last release candidate, please have a look at the project roadmap and the interim version of the release notes.

news.title: Castor 0.9.9 - 1st milestone build
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
I've placed a copy of the 1st Castor 0.9.9 milestone build at the Codehaus.
This is a major feature release. For details about the features added and the bugs fixed, please have a look at the project roadmap and the interim version of the release notes.
This milestone will be replaced by a second milestone within a week, so please try this version and report any regression issues (where applicable).

news.title: Castor 0.9.7 - Final release
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
I've placed a copy of Castor 0.9.7 (final) at The Codehaus.
This is mainly a maintenance release. For details about the bugs fixed and features provided, please have a look at the release notes.
Please report any issues through the project's issue tracking system and/or the mailing lists.

news.title: Castor 0.9.7 - 1st milestone build
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
I've placed a copy of the 1st Castor 0.9.7 milestone build at the Codehaus.
This is a maintenance release for release 0.9.6 only. For details about the bugs fixed, please have a look at the project roadmap and the interim version of the release notes.
This milestone will be replaced by a second milestone within a week, so please try this version and report any regression issues (where applicable).

news.title: Werner Guttmann Promoted to Castor JDO Lead
news.author: Bruce Snyder
news.summary: After having lead Castor JDO since 2002, Bruce has decided to pass the torch to Werner Guttmann. Werner has been a force on the project since he began contributing and his tireless efforts are exactly what the project needs to continue. Congratulations, Werner and keep up the great work!

news.title: New Castor roadmap
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
For information about upcoming Castor releases and future development areas in general, please have a look at the Castor roadmap.
As it stands right now, this will reveal that we have scheduled two releases (0.9.7 and 0.9.9) within the next 5 weeks, the former designated to be a maintenance release for Castor 0.9.6, the latter planned as a feature release with quite some new features and improvements to be added.

news.title: Castor forums currently unavailable
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
Many of you will have recognized by now that the exolab.org domain had been voided as of last Friday. As a result of this, the Castor user forums are not available.
Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience you are experiencing and rest assured that we are working to get it back online as soon as possible.

news.title: New issue tracking tool
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
This is to announce that we finally moved our issue tracking tool from Exolab Bugzilla to the Codehaus JIRA.
We'd like to offer our apologies for any inconvenience you experienced as a result of this migration and hope that you like our new home for tracking (and resolving) issues as much as we do.

news.title: How to submit a patch - New guidelines
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary: This is to announce that we now provide unified instructions on how to submit a patch at http://castor.codehaus.org/how-to-submit-a-bug.html. To facilitate this task, we are now providing a template for Castor JDO related patches that has been added to the CVS sources already.

news.title: Support for polymorphism - A test drive
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
One of the major short-comings of Castor JDO always has been missing support for polymorphism. After the 0.9.6 release back in Februray, which mainly focused on bug fixing, we decided to tackle this missing feature and start work for adding support for polymorphism to Castor JDO. For a complete history of the work done so far and the tests conducted, please have a look at bug 1881.
As of last week, most of the work (originally initiated by myself) has been finished, and we are now in a position where we'd like to ask you, our users, for feedback. In other words, we think that the current implementation is stable enough to make it available as described below. But as we want to get this new feature as stable as possible before heading for a new release (most likely 0.9.7, but maybe 1.0), we now need feedback from our users.
To facilitate this, I've made available binaries here. Please use the source distribution if possible, as it contains the tests mentioned above as well.

news.title: Mailing list changes
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
This is to announce that we finally moved our mailing lists to the Codehaus. As part of this move, we moved your subscriptions to spare you the work of having to re-subscribe. If you feel that you are subscribed to one of the mailing lists by fault, please use the below addresses to unsubscribe.
As of now, please use the following email addresses:
* User mailing list
To post a message: user@castor.codehaus.org
To subscribe: user-subscribe@castor.codehaus.org
To unsubscribe: user-unsubscribe@castor.codehaus.org
Archive: http://archive.castor.codehaus.org/user
* Announcement mailing list
To post a message: announce@castor.codehaus.org
To subscribe: announce-subscribe@castor.codehaus.org
To unsubscribe: announce-unsubscribe@castor.codehaus.org
Archive: http://archive.castor.codehaus.org/announce
* Development mailing list
To post a message: dev@castor.codehaus.org
To subscribe: dev-subscribe@castor.codehaus.org
To unsubscribe: dev-unsubscribe@castor.codehaus.org
Archive: http://archive.castor.codehaus.org/dev
For a period of 14 days, we'll be monitoring the old lists at Exolab, mainly referring you to the lists mentioned above. After this period, we will turn off these lists at our discretion. As for mailing lists archives, please note that at the moment, the archives mentioned above don't hold any messages from the old lists, but we are working on a solution. As such, messages from the lists at Exolab will be available at the usual sites.

news.title: RSS feed available
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary: We are happy to provide an RSS feed for announcements related to Castor here. This service basically mirrors the information provided at our news page.

news.title: Castor - A new home
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
After over five years of Exolab sponsoring Castor, the Castor team recently decided to move the entire project to a new home at the Codehaus. The team would like to thank Exolab and it's parent company Intalio, Inc. for it's long-standing support of the project.
Please use the below links for access to ...
- Main documentation
- CVS Repository
- Download

news.title: Castor JDO - New committers
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
Please join me to welcome Gregory Block, Martin Fuchs, Ralf Joachim and Stein as new committers for Castor JDO. I am more than happy to have them on board, as all of them have shown their dedication to the project through numerous occasions (incl. patches and willingness to spend time with myself ...).
Details about the current and past committers (as well as contributors) can be found at here.

news.title: Castor 0.9.6 - Final release
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
I've placed a copy of Castor 0.9.6 (final) on the FTP Server.
This is mainly a bug fix release, but includes a couple of new features as well. For details about the bugs fixed and features provided, please have a look at the release notes.
Please report any issues through the project's issue tracking system and/or the mailing lists.

news.title: Castor 0.9.6 - 3rd release candidates
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
I've placed a copy of the 3rd and final Castor 0.9.6 release candidate on the FTP Server.
This is a bug fix release only. For details about the bugs fixed sinc the last release candidate, please have a look at (an interim version of) the release notes.
The release candidate will be replaced by the official version within about a week, so please try this version and report any regression issues (where applicable).

news.title: Castor 0.9.5.4 Final Release
news.author: Keith Visco
news.summary:
I've placed a copy of Castor 0.9.5.4 final on the FTP Server.
This is a bug fix release, so please do not expect new features slated for 0.9.6 to appear in this release.
Sorry for the delay in officially announcing the release, it's actually been available on the FTP Server for a couple weeks now!

news.title: Castor 0.9.6 Release Candidates
news.author: Werner Guttmann
news.summary:
I've placed a copy of the first Castor 0.9.6 release candidate on the FTP Server.
This is mainly a bug fix release, but includes a couple of new features as well. For details about the bugs fixed and features provided, please have a look at (an interim version of) the release notes.
The release candidate will be replaced by the official version within the next three or four weeks, so please try this version and report any regression issues (where applicable). A regression for this release is something that was working in 0.9.5.4 but no longer is working in this 0.9.6 release candidate. Only regression issues will be considered for fixing before the final 0.9.6 release.
All other bugs will be moved out to 0.9.7, or a 0.9.6.x sub-release if necessary.

news.title: Castor 0.9.5.4 Release Candidates
news.author: Keith Visco
news.summary:
I've placed a copy of the latest Castor 0.9.5.4 release candidate on the FTP Server.
This is a bug fix release, so please do not expect new features slated for 0.9.6 to appear in this release. The release candidate will be replaced by the official version by end of the week, so please try this version and report any regression issues. A regression for this release is something that was working in 0.9.5.3 but no longer working in this 0.9.5.4 release candidate. Only regression issues will be considered for fixing before the final release. All other bugs will be moved out to 0.9.6, or a 0.9.5.5 release if necessary.

news.title: Castor Message Board
news.author: Keith Visco
news.summary:
The Castor site now has a new message board.
Message boards are typically more user-friendly than mailing lists as they keeps the information in a much more organized fashion and don't add to our ever increasing inboxes.
The mailing lists will continue to remain open and you can choose which ever communication method you prefer.

news.title: CastorLive Book in the Works
news.author: Bruce Snyder
news.summary:
Bruce Snyder is now authoring Castor Live for SourceBeat Publishing. The first cut of the book will be out by the end of the July containing the first few chapters.
The SourceBeat model is very different from traditional publishing because books are published online and updated every month by the author! Subscribers to a book receive a one year subscription and receive all updates to the title for that year. Also check out the Castor Live blog for additional information.

news.title: Current Release
news.author: Keith Visco
news.summary:
Version 0.9.5.3 is now available for download.
Changes in 0.9.5.3

news.title: Next Release
news.author: Keith Visco
news.summary: Next scheduled release (0.9.6): June, 7 2004 (tentative).

news.title: Possible Interim Release
news.author: Keith Visco
news.summary: An interim release (0.9.5.4) may be released sooner for any regression issues still present in 0.9.5.3.

news.title: Welcome Stein Hugubakken to the Team
news.author: Bruce Snyder
news.summary: Please welcome Stein Hugubakken as the latest addition to team Castor! Stein has been active with Castor since early this year and we're very happy to have him on board.

news.title: Welcome Patrick van Kaan to the Team
news.author: Bruce Snyder
news.summary: Please welcome Patrick van Kaan as the latest addition to team Castor! Patrick has been using Castor JDO for a while now and is the developer behind the Castor-Taglib project.

news.title: Welcome Werner Guttmann to the Team
news.author: Bruce Snyder
news.summary: Please welcome Werner Guttman as the newest committer to the Castor team! Werner's contributions moving forward with the Castor JDO refactoring are key, as is his experience with J2EE and IBM WebSphere.

news.title: CastorWiki Now Available
news.author: Keith Visco
news.summary: Can't find it here? Check out the CastorWiki. An effort put together by a number of Castor users to document the undocumented! Hosted off site by Lance Lavandowska, and championed by Tek1 (whose real name is a mystery to us all!).

news.title: RefactorIt to Include Castor
news.author: Keith Visco
news.summary: We're pleased to announce that the folks at RefactorIt have included Castor as part of their Open Source Community License. This means anyone who works on the Castor code base can download a copy of RefactorIt and use it when working on the Castor code.

news.title: Congratulations Bruce!
news.author: Keith Visco
news.summary: Congratulations to Bruce Snyder and his family on the birth of their second daughter, the youngest member of the Castor team, we can't wait until she's old enough to start programming!

news.title: Welcome Mickaël Guessant to the Team
news.author: Bruce Snyder
news.summary: Please welcome our newest addition to the Castor team of committers, Mickaël Guessant! Mickaël is a very welcome addition to the Castor JDO team.

news.title: Bruce Snyder Promoted to Castor JDO Lead
news.author: Keith Visco
news.summary:
Bruce Snyder has taken over for Thomas Yip as the Castor JDO Project Lead. Bruce's name should be very familar to most Castor users as he has been an active contributor and committer to Castor JDO for more than a year.
A very special Thanks to Thomas Yip for the great job he did and all the contributions he made to the project.
